title: José Maria da Fonseca 2020 Trevo White (Península de Setúbal)
description: Given an attractive perfumed edge by the Moscatel in the blend, the wine is full of fruit and has a light bite of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2019 Porta d'Armas Red (Dão)
description: This perfumed wine shows cool mountain red fruits alongside acidity and young berry fruits. The wine is packed with fruit and is ready to drink.

title: Nola Grace NV Carbonated Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Very fresh and frankly fruity, this wine is light on its feet, offering tasty apple, jicama and banana flavors on a light body, with a supple effervescence.

title: Skyside 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Subtle pastry-shop aromas quickly give way to wood smoke and black cherry before the palate turns firm with tannin that grips cranberry and black-olive flavors. The wine has a Bordeauxlike austerity that needs vigorous decanting or more time in the cellar to relax. Best from 2024.

title: Parras Wines 2020 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This ripe, structured wine has layers of tannins, spice and toast. They combine with the developing blackberry fruits that show strongly. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Abegoria 2016 Herdade do Gamito Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)
description: This is an attractively mature wine with soft tannins and secondary flavors. Spicy and having fine berry fruit and acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Collalto 2020 Brut San Salvatore  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Creamy and fragrant, this offers aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and ripe orchard fruit. On the bright palate, vibrant acidity and a foaming perlage accompany white peach, green melon and Granny Smith apple.

title: Dark Horse 2019 Merlot (California)
description: A flinty character dominates this otherwise smooth and polished wine. Aromas of tobacco and wood char lead to herb-tinged black-cherry and black-currant flavors as light tannins add a bit of texture to the mouthfeel.

title: La Jara NV Frizzante  (Prosecco)
description: Made with organically grown grapes, this fizzy wine has aromas of white and yellow field flowers and almond. The dry, tangy palate offers ripe pear, yellow apple and lemon zest alongside bright acidity.

title: Simple Life 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This rich and densely packed wine is delicious and verges on sweetness. It shows ripe blackberries, strawberries and milk chocolate flavors on a lightly tannic and broad texture.

title: Parras Wines 2020 Alfacinha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Light oak aging has given this wine extra richness, spice and light tannins. It is balanced with richness, plenty of berry fruits and a vanilla aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Columbia Crest 2018 Grand Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas bring notes of cigar box, spice, tar and cherry. The dark chocolate flavors are supple, painting around the edges initially, with the tannins giving a light grip. It's a lot of wine for the money.

title: Domaine du Haut Bourg 2020 La Désirée de Haut Bourg Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
description: A selection from different parcels, this wine is full of fresh apple flavors that are lifted by acidity and smoothed by a creamy texture. This Muscadet has the potential for some aging. Drink from 2022.
designation: La Désirée de Haut Bourg Sur Lie

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2017 Dona Maria Red (Alentejo)
description: An open, generous blend that boasts rich Alicante Bouschet and perfumed Touriga Nacional. The wine is mature and smooth from its wood and its aging. Drink now.

title: Seghesio 2018 Montafi Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is rich and creamy in blackberry and cherry fruit, with light touches of nutmeg, cigar and leather. The tannins are thick and dusty, contributing a grip to the texture and overall weight of the dense, concentrated palate.

title: Cantine De Falco 2017 Bocca della Verità Primitivo (Salento)
description: This plush, supple red delivers cohesive aromas and flavors of mixed berry liqueur that meet gentle notes of campfire smoke and savory spice. Bright acidity and smooth yet supportive tannins give this Primitivo a structured yet balanced vibe.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2020 Riesling (Central Coast)
description: Tightly woven aromas of lime skin, freshly cut grass and chilled Asian pear flesh kick off the nose of this appellation blend. Sour lime skin and more lawn clippings show on the palate, where the acidity leads into a dried citrus finish.

title: Menhir Salento 2014 Calamuri Primitivo (Salento)
description: Rich aromas of liquor-soaked black cherry and blackberry meld with accents of game, earth and violet in this dense red. It's luscious and rounded on the palate, supported by velvety tannins that wrap around a mix of dried and fresh berry flavors. Bright acidity keeps it all feeling lively and lengthy.

title: Grant Burge 2019 Filsell Shiraz (Barossa)
description: This is an old-school, oak-driven Shiraz, with prominent notes of chocolate and furniture polish amid ripe, plummy fruit. The acidity is surprisingly fresh after such a rich nose, saving the wine from stewed-fruit territory. But the oak, which drives the tannins, is a little too polished and prevalent for this reviewer's taste.

title: Grower's Guild 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Looking for a well-priced weekday wine? Look no further. This one is ready out of the gate, with aromas of black currant, tar and tin. Plump, expressive flavors follow.

title: Hearst Ranch 2019 Chileno Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Cherry-juice, coffee and smoke aromas come through in a thick way on the nose of this bottling. The smoke and oak flavors consume the palate, which also shows fig and prune flavors.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2020 White (Alentejano)
description: An attractive, lightly nutty and spicy wine. Those flavors contrast with the crisp apple and lemon that give this young, bright wine its lift. Drink now.

title: Icardi 2016 Parej  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of cedar, dark-skinned fruit and tilled soil emerge from the glass. The tight but already approachable palate offers baked plum, sage and clove alongside grainy tannins. Drink after 2023.

title: La Tordera 2020 Riva di Guia Oltreval Extra Brut Zerozuccheri  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Made with Glera and a small amount of Verdiso, this has aromas of medicinal herbs that carries over to the brisk, bone-dry palate along with citrus and mature yellow apple skin. Crisp acidity and a continuous perlage provide the energized backdrop.
designation: Riva di Guia Oltreval Extra Brut Zerozuccheri

title: Mark Ryan 2019 Monkey Wrench Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Merlot (70%) is the star of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (18%), Cabernet Franc (8%) and Petit Verdot (4%). The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of black raspberry, berry and herb, along with a dash of cocoa. The palate shows sophistication and polish. It's an unabashed charmer, with plenty of nuance beyond that.

title: Walla Walla Vintners 2019 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Over the decades Walla Walla Vintners has hung its hat on making flat-out delicious wines, particularly Cabernet Franc, and with new Winemaker Derrek Vipond at the helm and this his inaugural vintage, the winery's future seems secure. Cherry, chocolate, herb and freshly brewed coffee aromas are followed by supple, sumptuous fruit flavors. It's thoroughly delightful.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2020 Can't Stop Denner Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This bright, superfresh and engaging bottling is an antidote to the very ripe style of Grenache that dominates Paso Robles. Aromas of pomegranate, hibiscus, rose petal and white peppercorns make for a delicious nose, while the floral aspects drive the palate, with ample crisp red-fruit flavors as well.

title: Paraduxx 2017 X2 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Zinfandel, this is a powerfully built wine, sanguine and savory in leather, tobacco and black currant. The fruit is plush and marked by hints of blueberry and black currant, and is velvety smooth through a long finish.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2020 Tenuta Regaleali Leone White (Terre Siciliane)
description: Heady aromas of citrus, yellow stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub are front and center in this lovely white. A blend of Catarratto, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon, Traminer Aromatico and Moscato, the bright, savory palate features juicy peach, ripe pear, orange zest and fennel seed alongside crisp acidity.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2019 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: Old vines give this wine concentration. It is densely textured, with ripe black fruits and some still-firm tannins. The structure and bold black fruits promise aging. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Cantina del Pino 2017 Albesani  (Barbaresco)
description: Full-bodied and delicious, this opens with aromas of raspberry compote, camphor and pipe tobacco. The palate boasts concentrated flavors but also a weightless elegance and energy, delivering dried Morello cherry, blood orange, licorice and baking spice alongside tightly woven, velvety tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it well-balanced. Drink 2024–2032.

title: Two Paddocks 2018 The Fusilier Propietor's Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Four years into the making of this wine—from proprietor and actor Sam Neill's vineyard in Bannockburn, right next door to the renown Felton Road—and the results are stellar. Indeed, Felton's Block 5 Pinot, in particular, seems cut from a similar cloth, but this bears the unmistakable mark of Two Paddocks. It's highly perfumed and downright sexy, a tightrope walk of evocative flavor (think fresh red berries, mushrooms and dried flowers) and ultrafine, ethereal tannins. It's so approachable and complete, in fact, that it'd be tempting to think it's simpler than it is. But wound up in one harmonious package there's a lot of layers to this little beauty. Drink now–2030.

title: Bruno Paillard 2008 N.P.U. Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This Champagne is produced from grand cru vineyards in exceptional years only. Rich fruits and layers of spice mingle with the toastiness of maturity in this equal blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The wine is now ready to drink.

title: Deutz 2011 Amour de Deutz Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A mature Champagne from a great vintage year, this is concentrated. With toast over the white fruits and with minerality still very present, the wine is taut, textured, vibrant and ready to drink.

title: Deutz 2015 William Deutz La Côte Glacière Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: The second of a pair of Champagnes coming from single parcels in Aÿ, this Champagne is finely textured, with superb balance between the mature fruit and great acidity. It is now ready to drink.
designation: William Deutz La Côte Glacière Brut

title: Hirsch 2019 Estate Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Gravel and stone adorn a fresh, focused and tension-filled palate of great acidity and coastal influence in this estate white, made in small quantities. The oak influence is minimal and well integrated while the fruit takes on a complex citrus-driven intensity and lemony finish.

title: Quinta do Crasto 2018 Vinha Maria Teresa Red (Douro)
description: Fermented in stone lagars, this wine has a rich, open character. From a field blend of old vines, it is impressively structured and densely textured. The black fruits and powerfully ripe tannins will take time. Drink the wine from 2025.

title: Handley 2018 RSM Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This graceful, layered and subtle wine deftly blends delicious plummy fruit with judicious oak spices and a hint of earthy, forest floor aromas. A gentle mouthfeel, medium to full body and lingering finish make it easy to keep sipping. It's the best of Handley's 2018s, and great to drink through 2028.

title: Vineyard 7&8 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This beautiful 100% varietal wine from the high-elevation estate is partially barrel-fermented and shows sophisticated tannin management and texture. Bay leaf, sage and cedar accent a full-bodied and concentrated core of complex red currant and cassis, with a girth of toasted oak, tobacco and cigar box playing secondary parts. Enjoy best from 2028 through 2038.

title: Reeve 2018 Wendling Vineyard North Slope Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This is a big but agile wine, framing ample, just-ripe black-cherry, cranberry and mint flavors in moderate tannins and lively acidity for great balance and good aging potential. Excellent concentration keeps the fruit and mild oak spice notes echoing on the finish. Best from 2026.

title: Lula 2019 Lula Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Gorgeous black fruits and enticing oak spice elements give this full-flavored, layered and well-structured wine more than enough pleasure. While rich, ripe and nicely nuanced with baking spices like vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg, good underlying acidity and moderate fine-grained tannins keep it fresh and appetizing. Best from 2026.

title: Beauregard 2019 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Stony aromas of seashell hover above the Asian pear, jicama, white-flower and light spearmint aromas on the fascinating nose of this bottling. The stony streak cascades through the palate, which is like licking limestone but with fuller flavors of lemony apple and quince. The acid-driven finish lingers for an extended period.

title: Bosco del Merlo NV Rosé Brut  (Prosecco)
description: Fun and refreshing, this easygoing sparkler has aromas of stone fruit and red berries. On the simple palate, bright acidity and lively bubbles frame white peach, citrus and a hint of candied cherry.

title: Campi Valerio 2019 Fannia  (Falanghina del Molise)
description: This white is demure in aromas and flavors of apple cider, crushed melon and peppery herbs. It holds a soft feel on the palate, with just enough acidity to lend support.

title: Cantina Zaccagnini 2020 Dal Tralcetto Dry Rosé (Colline Pescaresi)
description: Rather stripped aromas of orange rind and crushed red cherry don't give much away on the nose. There's some textural juiciness on the palate, with equally demure fruit flavors that end short on the finish.

title: Cottesbrook 2019 Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This pale gold bubbly smells of lychee, pineapple, melon rind and honey. It's softly fizzy, though the bubbles dissipate quickly. It's drier than the nose suggests but has just enough sweetness to give it a syrupy texture. The acidity seems a little forced, and there's a synthetic feel to the finish, but this is overall a straightforward, refreshing drop.

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2020 Viognier (Alentejano)
description: Spicy, with attractive yellow fruits and acidity, this is a full-bodied wine, rounded and with a shot of lime at the end. Drink now.

title: Long Meadow Ranch 2016 Rutherford Estate Merlot (Rutherford)
description: Given 80 months in French oak and made from organically grown grapes, this red impresses in its grasp of a leathery texture and rounded tannins. Pipe tobacco, currant and dark-plum flavors accent a well-integrated and balanced core of subtle power and elegance.

title: Nino Negri 2017 Inferno Carlo Negri  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, coffee bean and camphor aromas emerge from the glass. Boasting a firm structure and finesse, the savory palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, star anise and a hint of toasted almond alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2029.

title: Pol Roger 2015 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This rich Champagne highlights ripe Pinot Noir that glories in its red fruits and structure. Just ready to drink, the wine has intensity and well-textured acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Russiz Superiore 2020 Friulano (Collio)
description: Enticing aromas of white stone fruit, hazelnut and graphite along with a delicate whiff of hawthorn waft out of the glass on this elegant white. Savory and linear, the polished palate offers ripe yellow pear, baking spice and white almond alongside fresh acidity.

title: Schramsberg 2016 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: From stellar vineyard sites such as Keefer, Dutton and Hawk Hill, this Chardonnay sparkler starts out subdued and sleek, before unveiling complex layers of tart wet stone and acidity. The fruit is quietly layered, a structured foundation of green apple and Meyer lemon.

title: Schramsberg 2017 Querencia Brut Rose Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: This fruity and rich wine blends 74% Chardonnay and 26% Pinot Noir from great sites such as Hyde and Poseidon. Peach in color, it tastes of strawberry, peach and tangerine, and is made in a creamy and lush style that finds a freshness boost from plenty of acidity.

title: Amaze NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Serra Gaúcha)
description: Up front, this 100% Pinot Noir bubbly smells a bit flat and soapy. It's round and mouthfilling on the palate, but a bit clumsy and bulky. Red apple and cherry flavors finish steady enough.

title: Astoria NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)
description: This simple sparkler has aromas suggesting ripe white stone fruit. Reflecting the nose, the lively palate offers ripe white peach and candied notes alongside vigorous bubbles and brisk acidity.

title: Delibori 2020 Classico  (Bardolino Chiaretto)
description: The shy nose doesn't give much away while the simple, diluted palate offers the merest suggestion of sour cherry and peach. Brisk acidity keeps it lively.

title: Della Vite NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals subtle aromas recalling ripe stone fruit, citrus zest and pastry cream. The palate recalls orange rind, bitter medicinal herbs and candied notes alongside a vigorous perlage.

title: Emmitt-Scorsone 2019 Old Vines Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From organically grown grapes, this wine is funky and barnyard, with highlights of cherry cola and black pepper.

title: Famiglia Anselma 2011 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: This has aromas recalling cellar floor, leather, pipe tobacco and a whiff of violet. Showing the heat of the scorching vintage, the fruit is already dried out on the lean palate, leaving orange zest and the heat of alcohol alongside astringent tannins.

title: Paraduxx 2018 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon, with additions of Zinfandel, Petit Verdot, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Franc, this is a substantial wine with plush, generous tannins and oak. Cedar, dried herb and tobacco complement the rich black fruit.

title: Pizzolato NV Brut  (Prosecco)
description: This has delicate aromas recalling spring blossoms and stone fruit. Certified organic and vegan, the vibrant, lively palate offers banana and green melon alongside brisk acidity.

title: Planeta 2019  Cerasuolo di Vittoria
description: Mature dark-skinned fruit and vineyard dust aromas waft out of the glass along with a whiff of rusty iron. On the smooth palate, relaxed tannins accompany dried cherry, blood orange and steely mineral.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2017 Maria Rapaz Reserve Red (Tejo)
description: Now mature, this spicy, berry fruit and toasty wine has a bite of pepper, acidity and an attractive red fruit aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2019 Nana White (Tejo)
description: The wine is all fresh citrus, crisp acidity and bright, complex lightness. It is an attractive wine, lightly textured and ready to drink.

title: Sanfeletto NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Aromas of white spring blossoms and green apple follow through to the soft, creamy palate along with green melon, a dollop of vanilla and bright acidity. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.

title: Vaccaro 2020 Lisuli Red (Sicilia)
description: This organically farmed Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, culinary spice and underbrush. The savory, light-bodied palate offers juicy black cherry, star anise and cinnamon alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Ventisquero 2018 Grey Glacier Single Block Trinidad Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Spicy aromas of wild herbs, desert brush and dark-berry fruits comprise the nose on this well-packed Cabernet that feels a touch scratchy and bumpy. Black-plum flavors are generously backed by spice and herbal notes. It finishes with mild heat and a touch of juniper. Drink through 2023.
designation: Grey Glacier Single Block Trinidad Vineyard

title: Wente 2020 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Brisk lemon and dried citrus aromas meet with crisp pear and light butter on the nose of this bottling. There's ample freshness to the palate, where jasmine and pear-juice flavors are sprinkled with lemon and melon elements.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2020 Pegos Claros Blanc de Noirs Castelão (Palmela)
description: Castelao vinified as a white wine, this is partially oak fermented and aged. The result is ripe and textured, with apple purée and spice flavors. It has a hint of toast that has broadened the wine attractively. Drink now.

title: Zonte's Footstep 2018 Age of Enlightenment Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Cherries, peppery spice and vanillin oak lead the charge on this Shiraz. The palate would be medium bodied if it weren't for a powerful grip of muscular tannins. It's juxtaposed by juicy fruit, making this wine appealing to drink now with a meal or cellar for several years.

title: Cà di Rajo 2020 Cuvée del Fondatore Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple, white spring blossoms and bitter almond follow through to the dry, racy palate along with green melon and citrus. Crisp acidity and a refined perlage provide balance and support.

title: Bisol 2020 Jeio Rosé Brut  (Prosecco)
description: Fun and refreshing, this bright, easygoing sparkler offers flavors recalling creamy white peach, red berries and a dollop of pastry cream. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.

title: Four Vines 2020 Naked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Fresh and clean aromas of white-flower blossoms, lime juice and citrus peel show on the nose of this bottling. Broad melon and pome-fruit flavors show on the palate, which is quite salty as well.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2017 Coudel Mor Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A richly structured wine that has fine layers of black fruit and acidity. It is lightly spicy, perfumed and ready to drink.

title: Aimery NV Grande Cuvée 1531 Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)
description: Made from 55% Chardonnay, 30% Chenin Blanc and 15% Pinot Noir, this entices with aromas of lightly baked apple, toasted brioche and orange oil. The palate is bright and effervescent, with a plush mousse and ample acidity to keep it all balanced and refreshing through the close.

title: Antigal 2017 Aduentus Petit Blend Red (Mendoza)
description: Toasty aromas of creosote and campfire embers blanket secondary notes of blackberry and soy sauce. This blend of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot feels thick, soupy and viscous. Flavors of cassis, chocolate and oak spice finish peppery and jammy, with a raisiny aftertaste.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2018 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Cola and dark-cherry aromas meet with pine needle on the nose of this clonal showcase. The wine lands with a hearty presence on the palate, where tart blackberry and forest herbs play against a tart edge.

title: Le Brun de Neuville NV Autolyse Noirs et Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This producer, situated in the small region of the Côte de Sézanne, has produced an appealing blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Bright acidity is balanced by ripe red-apple and spice flavors, giving a rich Champagne that is ready to drink.

title: Marcazzan Fabio 2016 Pas Dosé  (Lessini Durello)
description: Showing class and personality, this lovely sparkler opens with enticing aromas of chamomile, Alpine herbs, citrus and white stone fruit. Made by one of the youngest vignerons in the denomination, it has a dry, savory palate featuring ripe yellow pear, apple and unsweetened lemon drop alongside bright acidity. A saline mineral note lends depth to the lingering finish while an extremely refined perlage adds finesse. This is a producer to watch.

title: Mure 2019 Orchidées Sauvages Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Lychee and gardenia on the nose are complemented by savory notes of dill and petrol. This clean, acid-driven wine has nice weight on the palate, which perfectly blends those lychee and dill notes. Floral characteristics and a hint of vanilla cookie come through on the generous finish.

title: Pol Roger NV Rich Demi-Sec  (Champagne)
description: This off-dry Champagne is very much in the house style, rich with layers of mature fruits. A ripe, full wine, it offers creamed apples and white peaches that are delicious now.

title: Robert Biale 2019 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is from an important historic site farmed by the Rossi family since 1920. Wood spice accents a soft, lush palate of blueberry and blackberry highlights, boosted by fresh, persistent acidity. Dried herb, cocoa dust and violet add to the complexity.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2018 Osterberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Grapefruit pith, pineapple and wet slate charm on the nose of this wine. A stony, grapefruit palate gets some softness from floral notes and a plush texture. Refreshing acidity tickles the tongue long into the finish.

title: Paul Dolan 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This reasonably priced wine is arguably one of Mendocino County's best Cabernets, year in and year out. Aromatic, complex, nicely ripe and full in body, it starts with enticing aromas of toasted oak, pencil shavings and cigar box followed by deep layers of black cherry, blueberry, anise and cocoa. Moderate, well-integrated tannins beef up the texture nicely and bode well for mid-term aging. Best from 2026.

title: Soter 2018 Origin Series Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: One of five AVA-specific Pinots in this new series, this intensely aromatic offering bursts open with lush scents of blackberries, cocoa and baking spices. The grapes were sourced from Zena Crown and the Soter Vineyard, and 20% were whole cluster fermented. Dense and bright, it's a compelling and spicy wine with exceptional balance.

title: Amici 2018 Flora Marie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Full of salty minerality, this impressive white offers a well-diversified and integrated wealth of fruit, from peach and pear to pineapple, changing as it goes. The full-bodied lushness of texture remains fresh and exuberant throughout, showing a great deal of finesse.

title: Far Mountain 2019 Myrna Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: High-toned and floral, this wine offers a generous mouthfeel of salty oak, mineral and wet stone. The elegant fruit profile combines pear, apple and Meyer lemon with ease, complementing the body weight with ample acidity.

title: MacRostie 2018 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: From the great coastal site, this white sings in fruitful intensity and complex layers of flavor, a burst of Meyer lemon and grapefruit crispness complemented by richer undertones of Meyer lemon meringue and toasted pineapple.

title: Hickinbotham 2018 Trueman Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This vintage of Trueman emerges as a quintessential example of McLaren Vale Cab, round in shape and fruit forward, backed by spice and savory herbs. It offers ripe blackberry, violet, tobacco leaf, olive and peppery spice flavors. In the mouth the plump fruit is tempered by the variety's typically powerful tannins. The juxtaposition works well, although it lacks some of the elegance and complexity inherent in the cooler 2017 vintage. Drink 2022–2036.

title: Kay Brothers 2018 Cuthbert Amery Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: A broody, savory Cab from one of McLaren Vale's more historic vineyards, this shows a dusty, old-school polish to accompany the vine age. Mint, dark chocolate, plum and cherry fruit and a backbone of pencil lead and dried herbs make up the nose, while the palate follows a similar flavor trajectory. Muscular, raspy tannins highlight the dusty, herbal nuances but don't overshadow the plush fruit. Don't touch this anytime soon. Drink 2023–2041.

title: Devison 2019 GPR Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a blend of 56% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 4% Mourvèdre, coming from a number of top sites that include Boushey, Southwind, Stoney Vine and Lawrence. Aromas of berry, pipe tobacco, ground pepper and fresh herbs lead to center-focused fruit flavors that are full feeling but still light on their feet. There's plenty of structure behind it all.

title: Devison 2019 Phantom Lamb Syrah (Royal Slope)
description: The Royal Slope is quickly establishing itself as a premier site for Syrah. This is another example. The aromas boast notes of smoked meat, savory herb, coffee, graphite, medicine and dark fruit. Full flavors follow, combining fruit and barrel, with Amaro-like bitters on the finish. There's a whole lot of structure behind it all. Give it time in the cellar to see it at its best. Best after 2025.

title: Sextant 2018 Night Watch Red (Paso Robles)
description: Savory aromas of smoked and roasted meats and iodine grow most elegant with hints of violet on the nose of this blend of 44% Zinfandel, 34% Petite Sirah and 22% Syrah. There's a strong array of purple fruits and flowers on the nose, from grape and acai to violet, with polished tannins that keep the wine in line.

title: Davis Family 2019 Soul Patch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an earthy, herbal and fresh white wine, the midpalate succulent in melon, pear and crisp apple. Focused acidity keeps it energetic and lengthy, textured and well integrated in spicy oak.

title: Succession 2019 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a blend of Quintessence, Candy Mountain and Ancient Stones vineyard fruit. The aromas are subdued and primary, with notes of flower, plum, ash and herb, along with whiffs of black pepper. The palate is all primary fruit, dipping in the middle before coming back together on the finish.

title: Tenuta del Pajaru 2019 Picuraru Organic Primitivo (Puglia)
description: A dense, brambly nose of dark cherry and blackberry aromas meets lifted elements of crushed black pepper and potpourri spice. It's plush and supple in feel, yet there's ample power behind all the rich berry tones thanks to lasting, fresh acidity.

title: Vetrère 2018 Tempio di Giano Negroamaro (Salento)
description: This red smartly matches intense brambleberry fruit with anise and orange peel accents. It's plump and pleasantly rounded on the palate, wrapped in velvety tannins and bright acidity for support.

title: Vigna di Pettineo 2019 Superiore Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of French oak, mature pear and eucalyptus form the nose. Made with organically cultivated grapes, the linear, vibrant palate offers crushed wild herbs, grapefruit, vanilla and a hint of butterscotch before closing on a note of salted almond.

title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2019 Elégante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: Matured in tank to preserve the fruit, this wine is bright and smoky. Perfumed with floral blackberry fruits, the spicy wine will be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Silhouette 2017 Cuvée 211 Reserve Red (North Coast)
description: Both aromatic and quite rich on the palate, this big but smooth wine is saturated in plump blackberry, ripe plum and dried fig flavors. It is mouthfilling, only slightly tannic and has a fruity generosity that lasts through the finish.

title: Marichal 2018 Reserve Collection Tannat (Canelones)
description: Pinched blackberry aromas include a note of leather, while this fresh-style Tannat is tightly wound, with high acidity. Short pops of tart black cherry, dark plum and blackberry flavors finish clean and short, with a dash of leftover oak.

title: Marie Copinet NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe, soft style of Chardonnay from family vineyards on chalk slopes presents layers of red apple and flashes of lime. It is lightly textured and openly fruity. Drink now.

title: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dark berry and plum meet with caramel on the pleasantly easy nose of this bottling. Tobacco and wood spice show on the palate alongside the dark-berry core.

title: Palladino 2017 Ornato  (Barolo)
description: Scorched earth, camphor, new leather and prune aromas form the nose. The assertive, monolithic palate recalls dried cherry, licorice and the scorching heat of alcohol that throws it off balance. Grainy tannins clench the finish.

title: Paris Valley Road 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly smashed black-cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with touches of tar, black olive and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of tobacco leaf on the front of the palate, which is firm with tannins while running through juicy flavors of blackberry jam and cherry compote.

title: Emercy 2019 Grenache-Cabernet Sauvignon-Petite Sirah Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fresh and yet very opulent aromas of black and red cherry meet with light caramel and chai spice on the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petite Sirah. Fresh and crisp berry flavors pop on the palate, aided by healthy doses of dried herb and dark spice.

title: Center of Effort 2020 Effort Rosé of Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Rose petals, light pluot and a hint of spearmint on the nose make for very crisp aromas in this Grenache-based rosé. There's tremendous texture to the palate, giving a grippy edge to the softer, fresh flavors of strawberry and watermelon.

title: Clementine Carter 2019 Larner Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: A light shade in the glass, this bottling pops on the nose with dried cherry, pomegranate and rose-petal aromas, with just the slightest hint of game lingering beneath. Bouncy fruit flavors of red punch zip across the acid-driven sip, where a grippy structure leads into a finish where dark-spice elements arise.

title: Fess Parker 2019 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean and approachable aromas of cherry and spice cake make for a familiar and delicious entry to the nose of this wine. The palate shows darker cherry flavors as well as plenty of clove and mace, surrounding a mouthfeel that is very full without being too rich.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2018 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Aromas of lemon peel, Gravenstein apple and struck stone light up the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tense and stony, but also generous in flavors of lemon cream and crisp yellow apple.

title: Crū 2019 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a vibrant and lively wine from an exciting vineyard. Aromas of raspberry sorbet, sage and white pepper lead the nose into a bright and zippy palate that's full of cranberry, plum and lingering cracked pepper flavors.
